title: Younger Generations Across AsiaAre Discovering Chinese Medicine
author: Stan SesserStaff Reporter
cleaned_text: April 28, 2000 12:01 am ET Last August, an elderly man walked into the storefront clinic of Tam Wang, a practitioner of traditional Chinese medicine in Hong Kong's bustling Mongkok district. Saying he had had a "good time" in China, he asked her for an antibiotic for venereal disease. "I know it's illegal to give out Western medicine if you're not a medical doctor, so I refused," she says. Copyright ©2023 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.
